instructions: Factorise each expression completely. This worksheet includes trinomials with leading coefficient ≠ 1, difference of squares, perfect square trinomials, and grouping with negative factors. Always check for common factors first.

questions.question: Factorise: x² - 9
questions.explanation: This is a difference of squares: x² - 9 = x² - 3² = (x + 3)(x - 3).

questions.question: Factorise: x² - 25
questions.explanation: This is a difference of squares: x² - 25 = x² - 5² = (x + 5)(x - 5).

questions.question: Factorise: 4x² - 9
questions.explanation: This is a difference of squares: 4x² - 9 = (2x)² - 3² = (2x + 3)(2x - 3).

questions.question: Factorise: x² + 6x + 9
questions.explanation: This is a perfect square: x² + 6x + 9 = x² + 2(3)(x) + 3² = (x + 3)².

questions.question: Factorise: x² - 8x + 16
questions.explanation: This is a perfect square: x² - 8x + 16 = x² - 2(4)(x) + 4² = (x - 4)².

questions.question: Factorise: 2x² + 5x + 3
questions.explanation: Using cross method: 2x² + 5x + 3 = (2x + 3)(x + 1). Check: 2x·1 + 3·x = 5x ✓

questions.question: Factorise: 3x² + 7x + 2
questions.explanation: Using cross method: 3x² + 7x + 2 = (3x + 1)(x + 2). Check: 3x·2 + 1·x = 7x ✓

questions.question: Factorise: 2x² - 7x + 5
questions.explanation: Using cross method: 2x² - 7x + 5 = (2x - 5)(x - 1). Check: 2x·(-1) + (-5)·x = -7x ✓

questions.question: Factorise: 2x² - 8
questions.explanation: First extract common factor: 2(x² - 4). Then apply difference of squares: 2(x + 2)(x - 2).

questions.question: Factorise: 3x² - 27
questions.explanation: First extract common factor: 3(x² - 9). Then apply difference of squares: 3(x + 3)(x - 3).

questions.question: Factorise: 4x² + 12x + 9
questions.explanation: This is a perfect square: 4x² + 12x + 9 = (2x)² + 2(2x)(3) + 3² = (2x + 3)².

questions.question: Factorise: 9x² - 30x + 25
questions.explanation: This is a perfect square: 9x² - 30x + 25 = (3x)² - 2(3x)(5) + 5² = (3x - 5)².

questions.question: Factorise by grouping: 2x² + 8x - 3x - 12
questions.explanation: Group: 2x(x + 4) - 3(x + 4) = (x + 4)(2x - 3). Factor out -3 from second group to match (x + 4).

questions.question: Factorise by grouping: 3x² + 12x - 5x - 20
questions.explanation: Group: 3x(x + 4) - 5(x + 4) = (x + 4)(3x - 5). Factor out -5 from second group to match (x + 4).

questions.question: Factorise by grouping: 4x² + 6x - 10x - 15
questions.explanation: Group: 2x(2x + 3) - 5(2x + 3) = (2x + 3)(2x - 5). Factor out -5 from second group to match (2x + 3).

questions.question: Factorise by grouping: 6x² + 9x - 4x - 6
questions.explanation: Group: 3x(2x + 3) - 2(2x + 3) = (2x + 3)(3x - 2). Factor out -2 from second group to match (2x + 3).

questions.question: Factorise by grouping: 5x² + 15x - 2x - 6
questions.explanation: Group: 5x(x + 3) - 2(x + 3) = (x + 3)(5x - 2). Factor out -2 from second group to match (x + 3).

questions.question: Factorise by grouping: 4x² + 20x - 3x - 15
questions.explanation: Group: 4x(x + 5) - 3(x + 5) = (x + 5)(4x - 3). Factor out -3 from second group to match (x + 5).

questions.question: Factorise completely: 4x² + 16x + 12
questions.explanation: First extract common factor: 4(x² + 4x + 3). Then factorise the trinomial: 4(x + 1)(x + 3).

questions.question: Factorise completely: 5x² - 20x + 15
questions.explanation: First extract common factor: 5(x² - 4x + 3). Then factorise the trinomial: 5(x - 1)(x - 3).
